DOCNAME: CASE OF SETA v. GREECE AND GERMANY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time) (Greece)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in NORP .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was arrested by the NORP authorities at the NORP borders under the charge of drug trafficking , as QUANTITY of heroin were found in the car he was driving .
CARDINAL . DATE , ORG , prosecuted the applicant for illegal drug trafficking and ordered his detention on remand ( order no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant alleges that his arrest was a set - up by a NORP national with whom he had disagreements in GPE - where the applicant had allegedly lived for an unspecified period of time - and that the drugs were put in the car without his knowledge .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant and sentenced him to DATE of imprisonment ( judgment no . MONEY ) .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged an appeal against the first instance court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first judgment ( judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG challenging the abovementioned decision . In the grounds of appeal no complaint was raised by the applicant regarding the interpretation service at the moment he was arrested and afterwards during the proceedings .
CARDINAL . NORP The hearing , which was originally set for DATE , was subsequently adjourned to DATE . As it transpires from the case file , the latter proceedings are still pending before ORG .
